intro: Castilleja campestris subsp. succulenta, commonly known as the plains milkvetch, is a hemiparasitic plant that belongs to the Orobanchaceae family. It is characterized by its reddish to orange-red flowers and is often found in open, disturbed habitats such as prairies and roadsides. The plant has a slender, erect stem and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It forms symbiotic relationships with certain root fungi, which help it absorb nutrients from host plants. This species is native to North America and is adapted to thrive in dry, sunny environments.
